color.default_value: Color for {{items}} with no valid value
color.ranking_intro: Add color points on this scale
color.shading_caption_1: The {{items}} are shaded to the color
color.shading_factor_description: Defines how much {{items}} should be shaded. Use 1 to shade all the way to the target color, or 0.1 to shade only 10% of the way, for instance.
color.source_description: Each edge is colored as its source.
color.target_description: Each edge is colored as its target.
color.title: Color

images.default_value: Image for {{items}} with no valid value
images.title: Images

labels.adapts_to_zoom: How much labels should grow with zoom
labels.default_value: Label for {{items}} with no valid value
labels.density: How many labels should appear any time
labels.size_coef: Labels sizes (higher makes labels appear bigger)

size.default_value: Size for {{items}} with no valid value
size.interpolate: Interpolate between custom min and max values
size.title: Size

zIndex.description: Allows customizing which {{items}} should be rendered in the front.
zIndex.none_description: Gephi Lite renders all {{items}} in the order it meets them.
zIndex.reverse_order: Inverse order of elements (lower values on front, higher in the back)
zIndex.title: Depth

deprecated.gexf_search_params: The `gexf=` url params to open a graph file has been renamed as `file=` in version 0.4.0. Using gexf params is deprecated  and might be removed in future version. Please use `file=` instead.

form.field_already_exists: The column with label "{{label}}" already uses the id "{{id}}".
form.unique: Value must be unique, and a data with the same value already exist

error.message:
Sorry, we are working to make gephi-lite better, but bugs still happened...
It will help us if you can open an issue on GitHub with a description of what you were doing.

not_found.paragraph: You may have mistyped the address or the page may have moved.
not_found.subtitle: The page you were looking for doesn't exist.
not_found.title: Page Not Found

error.title: Error

create.custom_script_description: These filters allow writing a JavaScript function that will tell for each node or edge if it should be kept.
create.edges_attributes_description: These filters allow filtering the edges based on their attributes. Some types of attributes are not usable as filters, in which case they are disabled.
create.nodes_attributes_description: These filters allow filtering the nodes based on their attributes. Some types of attributes are not usable as filters, in which case they are disabled.
create.topological_description: These filters allow thinning the size of the network using various topological methods.
create.what_kind: What kind of filter do you want to create?

filters.inapplicable: Range is only displayed when there is at least two values to filter on.
filters.title: Filters

kCore.core: k: minimum degree nodes should have
kCore.label: K-Core

largestConnectedComponent.label: Connected component
largestConnectedComponent.number: Number of largest components to keep

caption.disabled: Caption is available once appearance has been set.

gexf.success: Your GEXF export has successfully been saved.

png.success: Your graph PNG export has successfully been saved.
png.title: Export PNG snapshot

metadata.graph-type-undirected-warning: Applying this update will lose all edges directions, as they will all become undirected.

github.must-be-signed: This feature requires to be connected on GitHub

github.title: Open a file from GitHub

local.dragndrop_text: GEXF, GRAPHML or Graphology JSON are supported. You can also directly drop a file here.
local.error: An error occurred while opening the file. Please check that the file is a valid.
local.title: Open a local file

new.message: Current graph will be cleared, are you sure you want to continue ?
new.title: Open an empty graph

remote.error: An error occurred while opening the file. Please check your connectivity and that the file is a valid.

github.error: An error occurred while saving your graph. Please check your connectivity or try later.
github.title: Save on GitHub

local.description: Click below to download the workspace as a JSON file

circlePack.description: Arranges the nodes as a bubble chart, according to specified attributes

groupingField.description: An optional attribute to use to group the nodes
groupingField.title: Hierarchy attribute

circlePack.title: CirclePack

circular.description: Arranges the node in a circle
circular.title: Circular

layouts.description: This panel allows computing new coordinates to nodes of the graph.

autoSettings.description: Generates settings that fit the current graph the best
autoSettings.title: Guess settings

adjustSizes.description: Should the node’s sizes be taken into account?
adjustSizes.title: Adjust sizes?

barnesHutOptimize.description: Whether to use the Barnes-Hut approximation to compute repulsion in O(n*log(n)) rather than default O(n^2), n being the number of nodes
barnesHutOptimize.title: barnesHutOptimize

edgeWeightInfluence.description: Influence of the edge’s weights on the layout
edgeWeightInfluence.title: Edge weight influence

linLogMode.description: Whether to use Noack’s LinLog model.
linLogMode.title: linLog mode

attraction.description: Importance of the attraction force, that attracts each pair of connected nodes like elastics
attraction.title: Attraction

gravity.description: Importance of the gravity force, that attracts all nodes to the center
gravity.title: Gravity

inertia.description: Percentage of a node vector displacement that is preserved at each step. 0 means no inertia, 1 means no friction
inertia.title: Inertia

maxMove.description: Maximum length a node can travel at each step, in pixel
maxMove.title: Maximum move

repulsion.description: Importance of the repulsion force, that attracts each pair of nodes like magnets
repulsion.title: Repulsion

expansion.description: Percentage of current space that nodes could attempt to move outside of
expansion.title: Expansion

gridSize.description: Number of grid cells horizontally and vertically subdivising the graph’s space. This is used as an optimization scheme. Set it to 1 and you will have O(n²) time complexity, which can sometimes perform better with very few nodes.
gridSize.title: Grid size

speed.description: Dampening factor that will slow down node movements to ease the overall process
speed.title: Speed

quality.caption_CMax: of edges are shorter than Δmax thanks to the layout
quality.description: Are connected nodes closer thanks to the layout?
quality.title: Layout quality

random.description: Random layout positioning every node by choosing each coordinates uniformly at random on the interval [0, 1)
random.title: Random

script.description: Write your own layout by creating a function that returns a {x,y} object for each node
script.title: Custom layout

layouts.title: Layout

metrics.description: This panel allows computing new attributes to the nodes or edges of the graph. These attributes can later be used in the other panels, for appearance or filtering for instance.
metrics.edges_attribute_already_exists: An edge attribute named "{{field}}" already exists. Its values will be overridden.

attributes.ambiguityScore: Edge ambiguity score name (the inverse of the consensus of all the Louvain runs, 0 when all Louvain runs agree, and 1 when they disagree the most)
attributes.bridgeNessEdgeScore: Edge bridge-ness attribute name (i.e. 1 - the co-membership score)
attributes.coMembershipScore: Edge co-membership attribute name (i.e. the percentage of times Louvain set the same community for both of its extremities)
attributes.meanAmbiguityScore: Node average linked edges ambiguity score attribute name
attributes.sourceCommunityId: Edge source modularity classes (for coloring purpose in the preview only)

louvainEdgeAmbiguity.description: This algorithm helps exploring ambiguity in Louvain community detection. It runs the Louvain algorithm N times, and analyzes how consistent Louvain is along multiple runs, looking on each edge if its extremities are in the same cluster or not..

getEdgeWeight.description: An edge attribute that would represent edge weights.
getEdgeWeight.title: Louvain edge weight attribute

resolution.description: An increased resolution should produce more communities.
resolution.title: Louvain resolution

runs.description: The number of times to run Louvain algorithm.
runs.title: Louvain runs

louvainEdgeAmbiguity.preview_description: One way to represent the edges ambiguity visually, is to use the modularity classes to color edges, while highlighting in white the most ambiguous nodes and edges.
louvainEdgeAmbiguity.title: Louvain edges ambiguity

louvain.description: This algorithm aims at splitting the nodes as densely connected groups.

fastLocalMoves.description: Whether to use a well-known optimization relying on a queue set to traverse the graph more efficiently.
fastLocalMoves.title: Fast local moves

getEdgeWeight.description: An edge attribute that would represent edge weights.
getEdgeWeight.title: Edge weight attribute

randomWalk.description: Whether to traverse the graph randomly.
randomWalk.title: Random walk

resolution.description: An increased resolution should produce more communities.
resolution.title: Resolution

louvain.title: Louvain community detection

metrics.success: The {{items}} metrics "{{metrics}}" have been added to the data.
metrics.success_one: The {{items}} metric "{{metrics}}" has been added to the data.
metrics.title: Metrics
